description:
When someone dies, what should their final words be? Words that couldn't be said while still alive - of love, hate, hope, regret or perhaps words without any importance. These words are sent through letters called "shigofumi" from the recently deceased to the living. Mikawa Fumika is a mail carrier of these shigofumi, delivering them alongside staff and her partner Kanaka. However, there must be something more behind Fumika's silent exterior; shigofumi mail carriers are deceased humans with the same appearance they had just before death. Despite this, Fumika is still aging...

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Tennis
tags.description: Centers around the sport of tennis.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Office Lady
tags.description: Prominently features a female office worker or OL.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

node.description: [Blog](http://kuroboshi.blog34.fc2.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kuroboshi) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/178217)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ichirou_o)

Waseda University graduate. Best known as the co-creator of [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/116444028) | [Website](http://www.dragon-brave.com)

[Website](https://aliproject.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/alipro_yukyokai) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/allica_ism/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/AliProjectYukyokai) Introduction Ali Project (typeset as ALI PROJECT) is a Japanese band with a strong Japanese Aristocrat-style image, consisting of Arika Takarano and Mikiya Katakura. Biography In the band's earlier days, their musical style tended towards light, cheerful and/or refreshing songs. However, the sound has changed in recent times to take on a darker and more mysterious tone. Takarano Arika, lead singer/lyricist, has termed this change as a transition from White Alice (白アリ) to Black Alice (黒アリ). Though there has been a general shift towards performing songs in the "Black Alice" phase, Ali Project has occasionally sung in the White Alice style as well. In 1988 they made their indie debut in the chartsas Ari (Ant) Project (蟻プロジェクト) with their album Fantastic Garden (幻想庭園 Gensou Teien). The album was later included in Tatsumi Takayuki's book Philosophy of Progressive Rock (プログレッシヴ・ロックの哲学), which led to the band being classified under the progressive rock genre. Four years later in 1992 they changed their name and made their major debut with their single "Fall in love, maiden" (恋せよ乙女 Koi-seyo otome). Most of their records are released by Toshiba-EMI, Victor Entertainment and Tokuma Japan. The band is notable in the anime community for having their songs featured in several anime opening and ending sequences, most notably the series Noir and Rozen Maiden. Members - [Arika Takarano](https://anilist.co/staff/101307/Arika-Takarano) (宝野アリカ) - vocals, lyrics - [Mikiya Katakura](https://anilist.co/staff/101309/Mikiya-Katakura) (片倉三起也) - music, arrangement (Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

He made his full directorial debut with the release of [Honey and Clover II](https://anilist.co/anime/1142/Hachimitsu-to-Clover-II/) in 2006, after which he directed [Idolmaster: Xenoglossia](https://anilist.co/anime/1694/Idolmster-Xenoglossia/) in 2007, and [Toradora!](https://anilist.co/anime/4224/Toradora/) in 2008. He has also directed the spin-off series of [Toaru Majutsu no Index](https://anilist.co/anime/4654/Toaru-Majutsu-no-Index/), respectively named [Toaru Kagaku no Railgun](https://anilist.co/anime/6213/Toaru-Kagaku-no-Railgun/), which released in 2009.

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.
Originating from Jungle Gym.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/436797162)

Married to animator [Maki Fujii](https://anilist.co/staff/101081/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/codamasaori) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/codamasaori/)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Sakurabi made his directional debut with [Gunparade March](https://anilist.co/anime/266/). He is a fan of simple and refreshing love stories. As a director he's known for modifying original stories a lot, which has brought him substantial amounts of critique. He is quite infamous for his work as the director of the [Tsukihime](https://anilist.co/anime/169/) adaptation, with most fans disapproving of his changes from the original visual novel.

Amongst his most notable directorial works are [Yomigaeru Sora: Rescue Wings](https://anilist.co/anime/798/) and [Flying Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/21284/).

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators. His drawing corrections as animation director are known for his advanced drawing skills. Additionally, he is occasionally entrusted with powerful character acting and action sequences.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/128469808)

Handles design research. Animates and designs stuff on occasion.
Affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures)
Mayumi Okamoto is an animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ichirou_o)

Waseda University graduate. Best known as the co-creator of [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/).
Affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures)
Fusako Nomura is an animator.

__Eiko Morikawa__ is a Japanese sound effects editor. She started working at Swara Production, then went to Rakuonsha, and now is the representative director of Chura Sound.

(Source: AniDB)

__Aliases:__ ポッキー (Pocky), 社長 (President)

__Shunji Inoue__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger, producer and animation planner. He founded the music publishing company Lantis in 1999 and became its president.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/546134514)

Representative director of REAL-T.

Yoshio Ookouchi is a composite artist affiliated with A-1 Pictures.
